description: A web-based application for reconciling financial data from multiple sources with intelligent matching, variance analysis, and automated insights
objectives: Automate reconciliation of financial data between different systems
Handle variations in data formats and column names
Identify matches with minor discrepancies (amount differences, date variations, name variations)

features.name: Dual File Upload
features.description: Upload and compare two CSV/JSON files
acceptanceCriteria: Support CSV and JSON file formats
Display file name and size after upload
Show validation errors for invalid files

features.name: Intelligent Column Mapping
features.description: Automatically detect and map columns (docNo, party, date, amount, tax)

features.name: Smart Reconciliation
acceptanceCriteria: Categorize results as matched, partial, or unmatched

features.name: Visual Dashboard
acceptanceCriteria: Show matched, partial, and unmatched counts

features.name: Interactive Results Table
features.description: Color-coded rows with filtering and sorting

features.name: Automated Insights
acceptanceCriteria: Identify vendors with high mismatch rates
Show date patterns in unmatched entries

features.name: Export Functionality
acceptanceCriteria: Include all relevant columns in export

features.name: Demo Mode
features.description: Pre-loaded sample data for quick testing
acceptanceCriteria: Sample data includes various match scenarios
Clear indication when demo mode is active

userStories.title: Upload Files
userStories.description: As a user, I want to upload two CSV/JSON files so that I can compare financial data from different sources

userStories.title: File Validation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see file upload progress and validation errors so that I know if my files are valid

userStories.title: Demo Data
userStories.description: As a user, I want to use demo data so that I can quickly test the application without preparing files

userStories.title: Automatic Column Detection
userStories.description: As a user, I want the system to automatically detect and suggest column mappings so that I don't have to manually map every column

userStories.title: Manual Column Mapping
userStories.description: As a user, I want to manually adjust column mappings so that I can handle non-standard column names

userStories.title: Data Preview
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a preview of mapped data so that I can verify the mapping is correct

userStories.title: Configure Amount Tolerance
userStories.description: As a user, I want to configure amount tolerance (0-20%) so that I can handle minor amount discrepancies

userStories.title: Configure Date Tolerance
userStories.description: As a user, I want to configure date tolerance (0-30 days) so that I can handle date variations

userStories.title: Fuzzy Matching
userStories.description: As a user, I want the system to use fuzzy matching for party names so that variations in naming don't prevent matches

userStories.title: Categorized Results
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see reconciliation results categorized (matched, partial, unmatched) so that I can focus on discrepancies

userStories.title: Summary Statistics
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see summary statistics (total matched, partial, unmatched) so that I can quickly assess reconciliation quality

userStories.title: Color-Coded Results
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see color-coded results (green/yellow/red) so that I can quickly identify match status

userStories.title: Filter Results
userStories.description: As a user, I want to filter results by match type, party, or amount range so that I can focus on specific issues

userStories.title: Search Results
userStories.description: As a user, I want to search results by document number or party name so that I can find specific records

userStories.title: Expand Row Details
userStories.description: As a user, I want to expand row details so that I can see full comparison information

userStories.title: Sort Results
userStories.description: As a user, I want to sort results by various columns so that I can organize data for analysis

userStories.title: Automated Insights
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see automated insights about discrepancies so that I can identify patterns and root causes

userStories.title: Vendor Recommendations
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see recommendations for vendors with high mismatch rates so that I can prioritize investigations

userStories.title: Variance Summaries
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see variance summaries so that I can understand the nature of discrepancies

userStories.title: Export Results
userStories.description: As a user, I want to export reconciliation results to CSV so that I can perform further analysis in Excel or other tools

userStories.title: Export Filtered Results
userStories.description: As a user, I want to export filtered results so that I can share specific subsets of data

workflow: Step 1: Upload Files - Upload two CSV or JSON files containing financial data
Step 2: Map Columns - Map file columns to required fields (docNo, party, date, amount, tax)
Step 3: Configure Settings - Set tolerance levels (Amount Tolerance: 0-20%, Date Tolerance: 0-30 days)
Step 4: View Results - Results categorized as Matched (Green), Partial (Yellow), Unmatched A/B (Red)
Step 5: Analyze Insights - Get automated recommendations
Step 6: Export Results - Download filtered or complete results as CSV
